p: To confirm the antiviral activity of the mixture, cells were treated with the highest concentrations (25, 50 and 100 µg/mL) of myrrh oil alone, myrrh oil + Vit. E (1%) and Vit. E (1%). The expression of viral nucleoprotein (NP) was analyzed by ICW, a method that allows the evaluation of the expression of viral proteins directly on an infected monolayer [ 15]. As shown in Figure 3, the expression of NP was significantly reduced using myrrh oil at 25 and 50 µg/mL in mixture with Vit. E acetate, compared to Vit. E treated–infected cells (considered as 100%). In particular, the percentage of RFI was 89.7 ± 3% (* p < 0.05 vs. Vit E), 58.3 ± 5% (** p < 0.01 vs. Vit. E) and 23.4 ± 5% (** p < 0.01 vs. Vit. E) at 25, 50 and 100 µg/mL, respectively.
